definition: picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility

sentences.english: The word "burden" is translated in the Bible margin, "what he (Jehovah) hath given thee."
sentences.chinese: “重擔”在聖經的邊注裏譯作“神所給你的東西”。

sentences.english: With a bare bodkin? Who would these fardels bear.
sentences.chinese: 誰願意負着這樣的重擔。

sentences.english: Your hair has been God to count, you have the burden enough for you Tam.
sentences.chinese: 你的頭髮已被神數算，你的重擔足以替你擔。

sentences.english: The discrepancy means poor countries will end up bearing most of the burden themselves.
sentences.chinese: 這種言行不一意味着最終窮國將自己擔起大部分重擔。

sentences.english: He's willing to shoulder the heavy burden of flaunting his riches.
sentences.chinese: 他願意肩負起炫耀自己財富的重擔。

sentences.english: He tottered under a heavy load .
sentences.chinese: 他在重擔下搖搖晃晃地走。

sentences.english: The burden of harvesting the family's corn fell to Zhang's parents.
sentences.chinese: 收玉米的重擔都壓在張榮威的父親身上。

sentences.english: Shaq takes some of the press off me and allows me to chill.
sentences.chinese: 沙克擔負了我身上的一些重擔，我可以少出點汗。

sentences.english: I made shoulder strong enough to carry the weight of the world. Yet, gentle enough to give comfort.
sentences.chinese: 我使她的肩膀能挑起整個世界的重擔，並且柔情似水。

sentences.english: Bound with all the weight of all the words he tried to say.
sentences.chinese: 他試著說出被縳上重擔的言詞，所有的。

sentences.english: The shoulder pole bent with heavy load.
I made her shoulders strong enough to carry the weight of the world; yet , gentle enough to give comfort.
sentences.chinese: 我使她的肩膀能挑起整個世界的重擔，並且柔情似水。

sentences.english: Are we weak and heavy laden, cumbered with a load of care?
sentences.chinese: 我們是否軟弱多愁，千斤重擔壓肩頭？

sentences.english: One thousand jins weight, everyone all have indexes on the head.
sentences.chinese: 千斤重擔人人挑，個個頭上有指標。

sentences.english: In a state of Awareness, one will have genuine Renunciation and naturally let go of all burdens.
sentences.chinese: 當一個人覺知時他就會自動出離與放下重擔。

sentences.english: The heavy heart is indeed a weight that will surely drag us down in our holiness and usefulness.
sentences.chinese: 灰心實在是一個曳我們往下的重擔。

definition: carrying pole and the loads on it/burden/task/responsibility/CL:副[fu4]
to shoulder (a burden)/to bear/to suffer (a disadvantage)
to bear/to carry on one's back/to shoulder
to support a family/to raise a family
to share (a burden, a cost, a responsibility)
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
